fagles-vs-lattimore.name: Fagles vs Lattimore

fagles-vs-johnston.name: Fagles vs Johnston

johnston-vs-wilson.description: Johnston's translation of the Iliad is characterized by a clear and accessible language, allowing readers to easily engage with the complex plot and characters, while Wilson's translation captures the epic's emotional depth and rich poetic beauty, bringing to life the intensity of the Trojan War and the timeless themes of honor and heroism.

johnston-vs-merrill.name: Johnston vs Merrill
johnston-vs-merrill.description: Johnston's translation of the Iliad captures the poetic essence and emotional intensity of Homer's epic, while Merrill's translation provides a more modern and accessible rendition without compromising the essence of the original.

wilson-vs-merrill.name: Wilson vs Merrill
wilson-vs-merrill.description: Wilson's translation of the Iliad prioritizes a more contemporary and accessible language style, while Merrill's translation maintains a more lyrical and poetic essence of the original text.
